I love converations that start with 

"Oh my God you are not going to believe what I have to tell you."

And end with

"Why are we so evil."

Sorry had to steal this Little...

<table width=350 align=center border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=2><tr><td bgcolor="#DBD7D2" align=center><font face="Georgia, Times New Roman, Times, serif" style='color:black; font-size: 14pt;'><b>Your EQ is 147</b></font></td></tr><tr><td bgcolor="#ECEAE6"><center><img src="http://images.blogthings.com/whatsyoureqquiz/emotions.jpg" height="100" width="100"></center><font color="#000000">
50 or less: Thanks for answering honestly. Now get yourself a shrink, quick!
51-70: When it comes to understanding human emotions, you'd have better luck understanding Chinese.
71-90: You've got more emotional intelligence than the average frat boy. Barely.
91-110: You're average. It's easy to predict how you'll react to things. But anyone could have guessed that.
111-130: You usually have it going on emotionally, but roadblocks tend to land you on your butt.
131-150: You are remarkable when it comes to relating with others. Only the biggest losers get under your skin.
150+: Two possibilities - you've either out "Dr. Phil-ed" Dr. Phil... or you're a dirty liar. </font></td></tr></table><div align="center"><a href="http://www.blogthings.com/whatsyoureqquiz/">What's Your EQ (Emotional Intelligence Quotient)?</a></div>

Life has no concrete securities. 

Life is always unceratin

Life will have a nasty way of bitch slapping you when you think everything is going to work out

Life is not fair, I never said it was, but it could at least give me some fair warning. 

Goddamn it....

My Life is Fantastic.  When you examine my dossier of life in the past 6 months I truly am living it to the best of my ability. 


I have all the peices, and I realized that I thought something was missing from my life. The only thing that was missing was love. Love for myself that is. 



The rest of life is just details, this that and the other. Not important and no reason to get all in to a tizzy over. 

Count the good, and don't put the bad in the limelight

You all have homes
You all have friends
You all have your health (Granted it might not be the best)
You all have freedoms that MOST do not
You all have life


So be thankful.


This Moment Brought to you by the letter V: V is for Vivi-fication


DMO

I am thrilled to say that flash flood warnings are just everywhere... Oh how I love a natural disaster to lift my spirits....

Spanks to All who responded to my disenchantement

DMO

I am disenchanted by quite a few aspects of my life The primary source for this disenchantment can  directly be attributed to men. However, it is my fault for opening up to those that are unworthy. 

I am not going to bitch and gripe. 

I am not going to cry and wail. 

I am not using my Livejournal as a whipping boy. 

I am just saying that I am disenchanted. 


I hope you are all well

With Love, 
DMO

Alive

Switching Jobs

Lonely

No one calls when they are intended to call

And no one seems to be able to see through the smoke screen of utopia like lives that some people live

I don't have the time to post in this blessed little refuge as often as I wish. Things are well in my life, and everything seems to be falling in to place. I am waiting to "drop my basket" but I think with the positive frame of mind that I am, that things will continue to be this wonderful. 

No, my happy readers, I am not drunk, I am just truly happy. I have so much to be thankful for, and I am not about to focus my energies on those things that bring me pain, unhappiness, stress, or anger. I should instead focus on what is pure and magical on this Earth, and that is what I am doing, each day it gets a bit easier to let go, each day I get a bit stronger, each day I have thanks in my heart for the majestic nature of the cosmos.


Thanks For Reading, 

 ~me

As Verizon Wireless Was Raping me in the Ass I decided it was high time to get a new prepaid phone from a company that doesn't suck

Cingular Baby! It's truly a better plan then anything in the area and I have a neato little phone that dances and makes me happy!

So if you have any desire to call me you should most likely give a jingle to the apt number or at work...


Sorry for the lack of posts but you know life is life and it is far too busy for words

Oh I think I get to see Caro soon, one of the Original Ya Ya's  so that should be fabulous

Oh and my ladies from New Orlean's are moving to Sayre and buying an Old Victorian that I get to help redo.

((Insert Happy Gay Man Dance!! I love being Martha Stewart)

On other news, well there is quite a lot of other news and I don't want to bore you with it. Perhaps when I have more then 6 seconds I will write some of it out


I am thrilled that Spring is here, I am looking forward to carmalizing my skin and swimming as often as I can. I have also lost my mind and I am walking 2 miles a day.  Yes you read correctly the gay man is getting in shape. Not that I am fat, I actually realized I am down 2 pant sizes so I just need to do some defention. 

I have Mansfield on the mind today, which is unusual. Eh, you'll have this

Love to All

David

Dear Live Journal Kiddos,

Well I know that some of you would have to drive thousands of miles, but I included you all for you are important to me in one way or another...

At Any rate, Sayre High School, my old stomping grounds, will be putting on a production of Bedside Manor. A Farce at it's finest! Set in a Hospital where the chief of staff's motto is "Laughter is the Best Medicine" I have been helping with the play since Februrary. It is a great show and the kids have given 110% of their energy, spirits, and time. Its been such a delightful and eye opening experience for me, once performing on that stage, and now helping to direct a new generation of 'Aspiring Thespians." It is so rewarding to watch the spark in their eyes, and for it all to come together.


Enough of me going on and on. Here are the Showtimes if you, in the odd chance, have nothing else better to do with an evening!



Bedside Manor

Opening Nite Thursday March 30th 2006
at 7PM

Friday March 31st 2006
at 7PM

Saturday April 1st
at 5 Am

(HAHAHAHAH APRIL FOOLS)

Starting at 7

Sunday April 2nd 2006
Curtain at 2
(This Last One I am Hazy About)

All Tickets or Either 6 Dollars for Reserved Seating
Or 4 Dollars General Admisson



(Also 4 Dollars if you are a Student of if you are old enough to wear Depends or use a Cane to walk Or you love the Early Bird Special At Cracker Barrell)



So This is All the Information! If you can come that would be fantastic I will be floating around backstage. If you would like to see me after the show, or during Intermission let someone know at the Ticket Booth!

With Love,

David

Guilt
What is yours?
Explain yourself
Culinary: Chocolate, and Crossiants Chocolate is my number one addiction. It makes me feel warm and safe, it is a comfort and a friend. Crossiants. There is something magical about peeling apart the flakey buttery goodness and tasting the delicate sweetness
Literary: Hrmmh I read too much Let's Say Harry Potter How could you question a world full of magic. Where a Flick of a Wand can create such happiness and unexpected surpises or kill an evil foe
Audiovisual: Chick Flicks, The Spinning of my Cd Player Chick Flicks. Such Guilt for watching them. I let them open my heart and pour forth the pain that is there and cleanse myself by rivers of salty tears. I bougth a new fangled CD Player and it has a vertical load and I just love to watch the Cd Spin and the blue haze of light that is cast upon it
Musical: Elton John and James Blunt Should I have to explain Elton John? Have you seen my CD collection. Have you heard the stories of my Elton John concert experience? Have you been to my house what is playing 9 times out of ten... James Blunt HELLO new up coming soul crushing musical artist
Celebrity: Jake Gylenhaalllll BROKEBACK MOUNTAIN HOT GAY SEX

So shoot me

I swear to Cher that I didn't copy and paste Hillary's Test Results
BLUES are motivated by INTIMACY, seek opportunities
to genuinely connect with others, and need to
be appreciated. They do everything with
quality and are devoted and loyal friends and
employers/employees. Whatever or whomever
they commit to are their sole (and soul)
focus. They love to serve and will give
freely of themselves in order to nurture
others lives. BLUES, however, do need to be understood. They have
distinct preferences and occasionally the
somewhat controlling (but always fair)
personality of a confident leader. Their code
of ethics is remarkably strong and they
expect others to live honest, committed lives
as well. They enjoy sharing meaningful
moments in conversation as well as
remembering special life events (i.e.,
birthdays and anniversaries). BLUES are
dependable, thoughtful, nurturing, and can
also be self-righteous, a bit worry-prone,
and emotionally intense. They are like
sainted pit-bulls who never let go of
something once they are committed. When you
deal with a BLUE, be sincere, make an effort
to truly understand them, and truly
appreciate them.

Got this For Me

When the rain is blowing in your face 
And the whole world is on your case 
I could offer you a warm embrace 
To make you feel my love 

When evening shadows and the stars appear 
And there is no one to dry your tears 
I could hold you for a million years 
To make you fell my love 

I know you haven't made your mind up yet 
And I would never do you wrong 
I've known it from the moment that we met 
There's not doubt in my mind where you belong 

I'd go hungry, I'd go black and blue 
I'd go crawling down the avenue 
There ain't nothing that I wouldn't do 
To make you feel my love 

The storms are raging on a rolling sea 
And on the highway of regret 
The winds of change are blowing wild and free 
You ain't seen nothin' like me yet 


Got This For you

 
I went to work for her that summer 
A teenage kid so far from home 
She was a lonely widow woman 
Hell-bent to make it on her own 
We were a thousand miles from nowhere 
Wheat fields as far as I could see 
Both needing something from each other 
Not knowing yet what that might be 

'Til she came to me one evening 
Hot cup of coffee and a smile 
In a dress that I was certain 
She hadn't worn in quite a while 
There was a difference in her laughter 
There was a softness in her eyes 
And on the air there was a hunger 
Even a boy could recognize 

She had a need to feel the thunder 
To chase the lightning from the sky 
To watch a storm with all its wonder 
Written in her lover's eyes 
She had to ride the heat of passion 
Like a comet burning bright 
Rushing headlong in the wind 
Now where only dreams have been 
Burning both ends of the night 

That summer wind was all around me 
Nothing between us but the night 
When I told her that I'd never 
She softly whispered that's alright 
And then I watched her hands of leather 
Turn to velvet in a touch 
There's never been a summer 
When I have ever learned so much 

We had a need to feel the thunder 
To chase the lightning from the sky 
To watch a storm with all its wonder 
Written in her lover's eyes 
She had to ride the heat of passion 
Like a comet burning bright 
Rushing headlong in the wind 
Now where only dreams have been 
Burning both ends of the night 

I often think about that summer 
The sweat, the moonlight and the lace 
And I have rarely held another 
When I haven't seen her face 
And every time I pass a wheat field 
And watch it dancing with the wind 
Although I know it isn't real 
I just can't help but feel 
Her hungry arms again 

She had a need to feel the thunder 
To chase the lightning from the sky 
To watch a storm with all its wonder 
Written in her lover's eyes 
She had to ride the heat of passion 
Like a comet burning bright 
Rushing headlong in the wind 
Now where only dreams have been 
Burning both ends of the night 

Rushing in long in the wind 
Now where only dreams have been 
Burnin' both ends of the night 



There and nothin' that I wouldn't do 
Go to the ends of the earth for you 
Make you happy make your dreams come true 
To make you feel my love

TANGOoBOy: No that wasn't my thought

Children whose parents beat them or worse. Children that this was their last dream before they leave this world. Children who need you. A smile a kind word and some magic. You have to go make magic my friend.

1300: know i truely understand why its so important to you
TANGOoBOY: My sister was a make a wish kid yesterday would have been her 37th Birthday
TANGOoBOY: I can't stop crying


It's Going to be Okay...Kiddo
Remember why you are making Magic...

God Help The Outcasts
Hungry From Birth
Show Them The Mercy
They Don't Find on Earth
God Help my People 
We Look to you Still
God Help The Outcasts

I ask for nothing I can get by. But I know so many less lucky then I. Please help my people the poor and downtrowd I thought we all were children of God. 

God Help the Outcasts Children of God.

DMO

As they pointed the Jag towards the West the sky was dark and foreboding as the two began their travels to the City of Brotherly Love, it was a complete blanket of gray wool with an orange spill near the center. It was a kind of sky that can warn of rocky travels or of the true beauty of nature. The two settled in to normal travel banter, how was your day, how was work, families etc. Neither of them cared about the answers but enjoyed the relief from the silence. Daniel gently reached over to rub Marcus' neck. That place where the hairline meets the soft skin, a place rarely touched. Uncomfortable, Marcus' pulled a bit forward and changed the station on the radio. Daniel was not able to quite interpret if this was a "don't touch me," shrug or Marcus not being used to his touch.
The drive was pleasant, both decided upon dinner, before merging with the Pa Turnpike. They stopped and ate a modest meal of the fast food variety, sharing french fries, and Marcus telling stories of times spent during his time at seminary. All of the seminaries would go to this particular restaurant for dinner on "nites off ." Marcus told a story about 2 of the seminarians who would constantly quote cardinal law, and how Marcus would put them in their place by saying "They're french fries, not doctrine." Daniel reminded Marcus about the lack of tonic water for G&T's so they headed over to the grocery to pick some up. Well the two could not resist the freshly made humus, the Brie, or the delightful multi grain crackers; their knees grew week after encountering the Double Chocolate Mini Milanos. Fifty dollars latter they climbed back in the Jag and headed south.
They discussed their plans for New Year's, how each had missed the others company. They arrived in Philly as the moon was cresting over the star filled sky. After a difficult check in, lost reservations prices misquoted, they packed a luggage cart and headed to their modest room. Of course the first order of business was cocktails. Marcus mixed two raspberry Martinis and lit two Marb Lights. Daniel toasted to " A New Year with New Beginnings." Marcus' eyes caught Daniel's, as if to say ''I am ready for a new beginning, I am ready to start again." The old friends, and occasionally lovers sipped Martinis and inspected the room. There was a hole in the ceiling, a patch of carpet gone and grimy concrete in it's place, half of the television stations were missing (including Lifetime: Television for Women and Gay Men who Love the Golden Girls), and they were both appalled by the used condom found behind the mattress. Daniel shrieked one of his high prissy screams, and Marcus' just laughed. Was it that Marcus' was laughing at Daniel's reaction or was he laughing at Daniel? Marcus' had often called Daniel, Mary or the Queen Mary, out of playful affection. Daniel never knew if he was being cruel or was just poking fun, he always hoped it was the latter. They both sprawled out on the King Sized bed, and flipped on the TV. Daniel of course had the controller. Daniel was the type of man that if he wasn't in control of every situation then he felt inadequate and sheepish. Hence, why his relationship with Marcus was so difficult. Daniel had no control. They both agreed upon watching Jack Nicklson be a complete ass hole in As Good As it Gets. They settled in both curled up on the large bed, with a healthy margin of air between them. They both turned their heads when the gay man gets robbed and beaten nearly to death. Commenting on how cold and unforgiving the world could be. They continued to watch the story unfold. Marcus told Daniel how if he ever had to sleep with a woman it would be Helen Hunt. Daniel valiantly tried to think of an actress that he would invite in to his bed, but of course couldn't Daniel had known for 10 years that he was gay and couldn't possibly think of a woman that he could actually enjoy intercourse with. Daniel eyed the Christmas Presents across the room. His thoughtfully wrapped in a large Silver Metallic Green gift bag with coordinating tissue paper in shades of olive, mint, hunter, and forest. Daniel was more interested in the small bag with the insane Santa in it. This was what Marcus' had bought Daniel for Christmas, this would be the present he wanted most to open since the Twenty-Fifth. The fiends didn't share Christmas, both being with their own families. Daniel spent a few moments during the day thinking of Marcus, wondering what he was doing, if he was enjoying his day, and wondering if Marcus was thinking of him. They sat on the bed cross legged and began to rip through their packages.
"Marcus what in the Gay Hell is this God Awful Japanese looking Santa Claus?"
"I had to find you the most ugly, tacky, hideous Christmas novelty I could find."
"Where did you find it?"
"Neiman Marcus, no you ass I got it at the Dollar Store."
Daniel laughed his deep soulful laugh. Marcus just smiled. Marcus started in on many of the heavy items in his bag. Daniel had found him old antique books on religion, politics, and a very old edition of The Divine Comedy. Marcus was thrilled and generally touched by the deep thought of each book. Daniel was tearing through the small festive wrapped boxes. Daniel of course asked if Marcus had wrapped them, to which he gave him his best stare of "duh." Daniel opened the first to find it a small flask, they both loved to drink together and apart. The flask was inscribed with one simple word: "Gin." In Daniel's bag there were another 5 flasks, rum, vodka, bourbon, scotch, and whisky. He was thrilled. His eyes lit up while opening each one. Yeah they were cheap flasks made in some sweat shop in Thailand or India, but he didn't care. It was something that Daniel could physically hold in his hand, and each time he used it he would think of Marcus. Not that Daniel needed an excuse to think of Marcus, he entered his thoughts and often haunted his dreams many times a week.
"Now before you open the velvet bag with the poinsettias in it Marc I want you to realize that I trucked my ass all over the Village to find that for you, so you BETTER enjoy it."
"Wow a controling threat over a Christmas Gift, only you Daniel, only you."
Marcus pulled the silk poinsettias from the bag and gingerly tossed them at Daniel. Daniel placed them between his teeth playfully. Marcus unsheathed the long slender package. His eyes popped as he realized what it was. About a year ago Marcus had mentioned his love for an imported Italian Liquor, Lemonciello. Daniel of course remembers everything and had spent a very cold and lonely day in the East Village of NYC finding it. Marcus hugged Daniel tightly and for the first time on the weekend their lips met. It wasn't a kiss with great furry behind it but gentle and familiar. Normally when Daniel kissed Marcus, for it was rarely the other way around, Marcus turned his head away and Daniel always got the stubbly cheek of the man he loved so.
Marcus sprung off of the bed to go get ice to chill down his favorite drink. Daniel sat at the bed quite contented with the fact that he pleased Marcus so much with his gift. He knew that Marcus even long after the bottle had emptied, the memories would remain.
Marcus came bouncing in the room, in his Puss & Boots, boots. Daniel called them his Puss & Boots boots because Marcus had small elf like feet and kind of strutted a little too proudly, it was cute and made Daniel laugh, a little too hard. Marcus chilled the Lemoncello and they settled back in to the movie.
They had both decided that comfy clothes were a far better idea then the tight Euro jeans they were both wearing. Daniel slipped in to his old faded Cat in the Hat lounge pants, and Marcus slipped on his Navy Blue Liz Claibornes, that Daniel adored since the Claiborne tag was stitched just above the cutest ass Daniel had the pleasure of staring at and occasionally resting his hand upon when the time was right, which it rarely was. The two settled under the covers in their respective positions, Marcus curled up on the left side of the bed and Daniel's long legs reaching the end of the bed. They both have had their share of Godiva chocolates, little crackers with Humus and Brie and far too many Martinis. As Marcus started to watch the movies with his eyes clothes. Daniel commented how his favorite line in the movie was: "You make me want to be a better man." Before he dozed off to sleep Daniel wondered if Marcus caught the hidden meaning.


***More to Come***

So I am sorry that I didn't do this before. New Year's Resolution will be me writing. Please tell me what you think about this. Sorry there was no Cut Before My apologizes to the people I angered, inculding the Monitor. I really didn't know how to do a cut before my friend showed me. I am not on LJ often so my apologizes again

Happy New Year Bored and Queer

His eyes popped as he realized what it was. About a year ago Marcus had mentioned his love for an imported Italian Liquor, Lemonciello. Daniel of course remembers everything and had spent a very cold and lonely day in the East Village of NYC finding it. Marcus hugged Daniel tightly and for the first time on the weekend their lips met. It wasn't a kiss with great furry behind it but gentle and familiar. Normally when Daniel kissed Marcus, for it was rarely the other way around, Marcus turned his head away and Daniel always got the stubbly cheek of the man he loved so.
Marcus sprung off of the bed to go get ice to chill down his favorite drink. Daniel sat at the bed quite contented with the fact that he pleased Marcus so much with his gift. He knew that Marcus even long after the bottle had emptied, the memories would remain.
Marcus came bouncing in the room, in his Puss & Boots, boots. Daniel called them his Puss & Boots boots because Marcus had small elf like feet and kind of strutted a little too proudly, it was cute and made Daniel laugh, a little too hard. Marcus chilled the Lemoncello and they settled back in to the movie.
They had both decided that comfy clothes were a far better idea then the tight Euro jeans they were both wearing. Daniel slipped in to his old faded Cat in the Hat lounge pants, and Marcus slipped on his Navy Blue Liz Claibornes, that Daniel adored since the Claiborne tag was stitched just above the cutest ass Daniel had the pleasure of staring at and occasionally resting his hand upon when the time was right, which it rarely was. The two settled under the covers in their respective positions, Marcus curled up on the left side of the bed and Daniel's long legs reaching the end of the bed. They both have had their share of Godiva chocolates, little crackers with Humus and Brie and far too many Martinis. As Marcus started to watch the movies with his eyes clothes. Daniel commented how his favorite line in the movie was: "You make me want to be a better man." Before he dozed off to sleep Daniel wondered if Marcus caught the hidden meaning.


***More to Come***

Dear Live Journal,

  So there I was out to dinner with Nick and Jen (Again Nick thank you for all of the MSG, Chicken, and Crab) So I have a message on my machine from my mother

"David I know you are sick and most likely curled up on the couch sick, but please call me back... I love you"

Phone Conversation With my Mother

ME: "Hi Mommy Dearest"
Mom: "Hello Oh Sick One, how is your nose"
Me: "Running faster then Flo Jo at a Track Meet"
Mom: "Are we drinking fluids?"
Me:   "Does Scotch Count"
Mom: "Well yes and No, anyway I was shopping at CVS and guess what I found for you while I was there?"
Me: "Tissues, Cough Syrup, I have no idea"
Mom: "A Guy that is so adorable it is as if he jumped off of the pages of A Dicken's tale"
Me: "Pardon, I could have sworn you said you found my a guy at CVS. Was he on clearence, I had forgotten that CVS had a guy section!?!?!?"
Mom: "Oh Don't be foolish, I was shopping for DVD's and this cute kid came up behind me and grabbed me by the waist and told me that the DVD's Were far too exspensive here and that I should come up to Video Circus and buy them there"
Me: "A COMPLETE STRANGER wrapped his arms around you that works at CVS???"
Mom: "Yes but that isn't the point. He's adorable, beautiful eyes a head full of brown curly ringlets, he's short, intelligent and funny, he's so your perfect type..."
Me: "Do we know his name?"
Mom: "No"
Me: "Do we know if he is single?"
Mom: "No"
Me: "Do we know if he is gay?"
Mom: "No"
Me: " So you are telling me that you want to hook me up with a guy that you don't know if he is gay or not, or even single"
Mom: "Well I was going to ask him if he was gay or not."
Me: "Are you out of your fucking mind?"
Mom: "Would that be rude"
Me: "Rude, yes I think asking a complete stranger there sexual prefrence classifies as rude mother."
Mom: "Well I was going to be nice about it."
Me: "Okay if he is gay it won't be a problem, but if he's straight he's going to be really offended"
Mom: "I don't care."
Me: "Alrightie then, so how are you going to ask him?"
Mom: "Well, how does this sound 'Hi, can I ask you a question... Well I was wondering if you happened to be gay, because I have a gay single son who I think would be perfect for you.' what do you think?"
Me: I think you are the sweetest person for doing this. And also fucking insane."
Mom: Well someone needs to be thinking of your love life.
Me: Thanks Mom. 
Mom: Alrightie I am going to go take a bath. I love you and will work on this tommorow.
Me: Okay Crazy Woman, Love you, will talk to you latter.


So whose mother exactly does things like this??? 

People wonder where I get my insanity from... I hope this answers their questions
